Checks if Azure modules are available.

True if available, otherwise False.

corebehrt.azure.util.config module

corebehrt.azure.util.config.cleanup_configs()[source]

Removes the temporary local config folder To be called after job submission.

corebehrt.azure.util.config.config_path(cfg_name: str, is_job: bool = False, default_folder: str = 'corebehrt/configs/') → str[source]

Create the default path to the configuration file.

Parameters:

  • cfg_name – name of file

  • is_job – Boolean indicating whether the path is local (=False) or on the cluster (=True)

  • default_folder – Folder to look for cfg_name (if is_job=False)

Returns:

Path to config.

corebehrt.azure.util.config.get_path_from_cfg(cfg: dict, arg: str, arg_cfg: dict)[source]

Helper for reading a config value from config (cfg), given the argument name (arg) and configuration (arg_cfg)

corebehrt.azure.util.config.load_config(path: str = None, job_name: str = None, default_folder: str = 'corebehrt/configs/') → dict[source]

Load the local config from the given path.

Parameters:

  • path – If given, load from this path.

  • job_name – If path is not given, load from <default_folder>/<job_name>.yaml

  • default_folder – Config folder if path is not given.

Returns:

dict

corebehrt.azure.util.config.load_job_config(cfg_name: str) → Config[source]

Load the config on the cluster

Parameters:

cfg_name – Name of the configuration file to load.

Returns:

CoreBEHRT config object.

corebehrt.azure.util.config.map_azure_path(path: str) → str[source]

Maps the given path to the correct format. Expect format of input path is:

azureml:* => Already Azure path, return as is. {researher-data,sp-data}:<path> => map to path on given data storage. {asset_name}:{asset_version} => map to Azure asset. * => assumed local path, return as is.

corebehrt.azure.util.config.parse_args(args: set) → dict[source]

Parses the arguments from the command line

Parameters:

parse_args – The argument configuration mapping for inputs and outputs.

Returns:

A dictionary mapping keys from args to the values passed to the command line.

corebehrt.azure.util.config.prepare_config(args: dict, inputs: dict, outputs: dict) → str[source]

Prepares the config on the cluster by substituing any input/output directories passed as arguments in the job setup configuration file: -> The file is loaded. -> Arguments are read from the cmd-line -> Arguments are substituted into the configuration. -> The file is re-written.

Parameters:

  • cfg_path – Path to the configuration file

  • args – parsed arguments.

  • inputs – input argument configuration/mapping.

  • outputs – output argument configuration/mapping.

Returns:

Path to the config on the cluster

corebehrt.azure.util.config.prepare_job_command_args(config: dict, args: dict, _type: str, register_output: dict = {}, require_path: bool = True) → Tuple[dict, str][source]

Prepare the input/output dictionary and construct the input/output part of the job command string.

Parameters:

  • config – Configuration dictionary.

  • args – Job args configuration.

  • _type – “inputs” or “outputs”

  • register_output – Register output mapping for _type=”outputs”

  • require_path – If True, paths must be set for non-optional arguments, or an exception will be raised. <require_path> is always false for outputs, and is only true for inputs, if the job is setup as a pipeline command (in which case the pipeline construction sets the paths before job submission).

Returns:

Tuple with input/output dictionary and argument part of command.

corebehrt.azure.util.config.save_config(cfg_name: str, cfg: dict) → None[source]

Save the prepared config before starting the job

Parameters:

  • cfg_name – Name of config file.

  • cfg – Dictionary to be saved.

Returns:

Path to the saved config

corebehrt.azure.util.config.save_job_config(cfg_name: str, cfg: Config) → str[source]

Save the config on the cluster

Parameters:

  • job_name – Name of job.

  • cfg – CoreBEHRT config object to be saved.

corebehrt.azure.util.job module

corebehrt.azure.util.job.create(name: str, config: dict, compute: str, register_output: dict = {}, log_system_metrics: bool = False, test_cfg_file: str = None, as_component: bool = False) → command[source]

Creates the Azure command/job object. Job input/output configuration is loaded from the components module.

corebehrt.azure.util.job.run(job, experiment: str)[source]

Starts the given job in the given experiment.

corebehrt.azure.util.job.run_main(job_name: str, main: callable, inputs: dict, outputs: dict) → None[source]

Implements a wrapper for running CoreBEHRT scrips on the cluster. Prepares input and outputs, sets up logging on Azure using MLFlow (if available), and finally calls the main script.

Parameters:

  • job_name – Name of job

  • main – The main callable.

  • inputs – inputs configuration.

  • outputs – outputs configuration.

corebehrt.azure.util.job.setup(job: str, inputs: dict, outputs: dict, config: dict, compute: str, register_output: dict = {}, log_system_metrics: bool = False, test_cfg_file: str = None, as_component: bool = False)[source]

Sets up the Azure job.

Parameters:

  • job – Name of job.

  • inputs – argument configuration for input directories, i.e. a mapping to configuration elements, typically in the paths sub-config.

  • outputs – argument configuration for output directories.

  • config – The config for the current job.

  • compute – The azure compute to use for the job.

Register_output:

A mapping from output id to name, if the output should be registered as a data asset.

Log_system_metrics:

If true, logs GPU/CPU/mem usage

corebehrt.azure.util.log module

corebehrt.azure.util.log.end_run()[source]

Ends an mlflow run. Used in the Azure wrapper and should not in general be used elsewhere.

corebehrt.azure.util.log.get_run_and_prefix() → tuple[source]

Get the run used for logging and a prefix. Depending on MLFLOW_CHILD_RUNS: - “prefix”: returns the top-level job and a non-empty prefix - “job”: returns the nested job and an empty prefix

corebehrt.azure.util.log.log_metric(key: str, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Logs a metric to the job (if mlflow is available). Parameters are the same as for mlflow.log_metric.

Important parameters:

Parameters:

  • key – Name of the metric.

  • value – Value of the metric.

  • step – Step for the metric (used for plotting graphs).

corebehrt.azure.util.log.log_metrics(key: str, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Log multiple metrics

Parameters:

  • metrics – dict of metrics.

  • step – Step for the metric (used for plotting graphs).

corebehrt.azure.util.log.setup_metrics_dir(name: str)[source]

Shorthand for starting a sub-run where metrics will be logged. Use as context manager.

Parameters:

name – Name of azure “sub-dir”/metrics pane.

corebehrt.azure.util.log.start_run(name: str = None, nested: bool = False, log_system_metrics: bool = False)[source]

Starts an mlflow run. Used in the Azure wrapper and should not in general be used elsewhere.

Parameters:

  • name – Name of run

  • nested – If the run should be nested.

  • log_system_metrics – If enabled, log system metrics (CPU/GPU/mem).

corebehrt.azure.util.pipeline module

corebehrt.azure.util.pipeline.create(name: str, data_path: str, computes: dict, config_paths: dict = None, config_dir: str = None, register_output: dict = None, log_system_metrics: bool = False, test_cfg_file: str = None) → command[source]

Create the pipeline defined in corebehrt.azure.pipelines.{name} using the given computes and configurations.

If test_cfg_file is given, each job type specified in the file is evaluated post-run.

Parameters:

  • name – Name of module defining pipeline.

  • data_path – Path to MEDS data asset input.

  • computes – Dictionary mapping >component_name> => <compute>. The dict must contain “default” as well.

  • config_paths – Dictionary mapping <component_name> => <path_to_config>. If a component is not set, the path <component_dir>/<component_name> will be used instead.

  • register_output – A mapping <component_name>.<output_name> => <asset_name> for any outputs, which should be registered as assets.

  • log_system_metrics – If True, metrics are logged for all components.

  • test_cfg_file – Optional path to test configuration file - if set, job types configured in the file will be evaluated after they have run.

Returns:

A pipeline (Azure command) to be run.

corebehrt.azure.util.pipeline.run(pipeline: command, experiment: str) → None[source]

Run the given pipeline command in the given experiment.
